channel.title: Page border?

</div>

</div>

item.title: Page border?
item.dc:creator: @sonny_bill_9 ``jason
item.description:
@sonny_bill_9 wrote:

[quote=“error.login, post:22, topic:188572”]something like this

#wrap
{
left:20px;
top:20px;
width:50%;
background-color:black;
}
#header
{
background-color:white;
height:50px;
}
#content
{
background-color:silver;
height:400px;
}

then

<div id="wrap">

<div id="header">
<h1>lala</h1>
</div>
<p>
<div id="content">
<p/>
The standard chunk of Lorem Ipsum used since the 1500s is reproduced below for those interested. Sections 1.10.32 and 1.10.33 from "de Finibus Bonorum et Malorum" by Cicero are also reproduced in their exact original form, accompanied by English versions from the 1914 translation by H. Rackham. 
</div>

not sure it would work but try something on those lines[/quote]

[quote=“error.login, post:24, topic:188572”][quote author=God of Ikiliki link=topic=251348.msg2106526#msg2106526 date=1205410200]

[/quote]
he needs ideas, what is wrong about learning from someones work? nothing[/quote]

item.title: Page border?
item.dc:creator: @Ixl_Adds_Ixl Ixl Adds Ixl
item.description:
@Ixl_Adds_Ixl wrote:

also you can use this code to if you want to add a class or id(which I personally do to all my sites):

Class version with HTML file:

<img src="#" class="xxxcenter" />

Class version code:

.xxxcenter {
       text-align: center;
}

[hr]

ID version with HTML file:

<img src="#" id="xxxcenter" />

ID version code:

#xxxcenter {
       text-align: center;
}

Read full topic

item.title: Page border?
item.dc:creator: @Cryme_Time Cryme Time
item.description:
@Cryme_Time wrote:

[quote="``jason, post:3, topic:188572"]well what i mean is this:

can you please put it into my code, i cant understand where to put it.

[code]

Site in testing 

    <li><a href="/index.html">Home</a></li>
    <li><a href="/smf/index.php">Forums</a></li>
	<li><a href="/smf/index.php?action=login">Log in</a></li>
    <li><a href="/links.html">Links</a></li>
    <li><a href="/Contact.html">Contact Me</a></li>
	<li><a href="/TOS.html">Terms of Site</a></li>
	<li><a href="/Search.html">Search</a></li>

    </ul>
</div>
[/code] also, there is space between my nav bar items and they have a blue outline, how can i change this? ps. the code is very messy, only the first few lines make sense, the rest are tests.[/quote]

Dude fuck off, your stealing my layout you faggit. bitch off you little cunt. you didn’t even bother to change the code around enough to make it seem like its your wook. jesus your fucking stupid, it still has all the links to my page in the nav.

item.description:
@sonny_bill_9 wrote:

I mean that on the bar that says “home” and “contact us” etc that the images are links are closer, have a look here kamilshairdressing.zxq.net .
Oh and after testing it doesnt seem to work well, heres the link again : kamilshairdressing.zxq.net and this is the code [code]

Kamil's Hairdressing body { background-color: black; padding: 0; margin: 0; } #container { margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; width: 800px; height: 100%; background-color: white; }

    //nav bar items







your stuff goes in here







[/code]
